meanings.definition: Not able to be removed or taken away.
meanings.sent1: The sticker on my laptop is irremovable.
meanings.sent2: The barnacles on the boat were irremovable.
meanings.sent3: The gum under the desk was irremovable, much to the janitor's dismay.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an irremovable mask, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The stain on the carpet was irremovable, no matter how hard we tried to clean it.

meanings.definition: That cannot be removed or taken away.
meanings.sent1: The curse on the ancient tomb was said to be irremovable.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti on the wall seemed irremovable.
meanings.sent3: The label on the jar was irremovable, making it impossible to know its contents.
meanings.sent4: The memory of her laughter was irremovable from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The shadow cast by the tree was irremovable, even as the sun moved across the sky.
